bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 121 (Thursday, July 25, 2024)][House][Pages H4949-H4950]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FOSTER:H.R. 9145.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I, Section[[Page H4950]]8, Clauses 1 and 18 of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:This bill gives the Director of the Office of FinancialResearch (OFR) within the Department of the Treasury solediscretion over the OFR's annual budget. It also establishesminimum funding and staffing levels for the OFR and for theFinancial Stability Oversight Council.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Enhancing Financial Stability Research and Oversight Act

item.title: Enhancing Financial Stability Research and Oversight Act
Enhancing Financial Stability Research and Oversight Act

To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to preserve the independent funding in the Office of Financial Research, to establish minimum staffing levels for the Financial Stability Oversight Council, to establish minimum funding levels for such staff, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
